title: Qualcomm Doubles Down on AI with Mistral AI Collaboration
description: We can expect Ministral 3B and 8B to arrive for developers soon via Qualcomm's AI hub. The post Qualcomm Doubles Down on AI with Mistral AI Collaboration appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: We can expect Ministral 3B and 8B to arrive for developers soon via Qualcomm's AI hub.
text: Qualcomm recently announced that it’s partnered with Mistral AI to integrate the latter’s genAI software to device running on Qualcomm’s new Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset, Snapdragon X Compute, as well as its new Snapdragon Cockpit Elite and Ride Elite automotive platforms. More specifically, the collaboration will bring Mistral AI’s Ministral 3B and Ministral 8B AI models for on-device usage. Due to their relatively compact sizes, the 3B and 8B are ideal for use with hardware including vehicular infotainment systems, smartphones, and even computers. They’re also power-efficient, and feature enhanced privacy capabilities. Durga Malladi, Senior VP GM for technology, planning and edge solutions at Qualcomm states: We are thrilled to announce our collaboration with Mistral AI to help achieve our goal of empowering devices at the edge with the latest advancements in AI technology… Mistral AI’s Ministral 3B and Ministral 8B will enable device manufacturers, software vendors, and digital service providers to deliver innovative experiences, such as AI assistants and other applications that understand users’ wants and needs, thanks to the immediacy, reliability, and enhanced privacy of on-device AI. READ: Qualcomm and Google Want to Make Your Next Car More Futuristic With all that said, we can expect Ministral 3B and 8B to arrive for developers soon via Qualcomm’s AI hub, which already features access to other Mistral AI models including 7B vo.3.
html:
Qualcomm recently announced that it’s partnered with Mistral AI to integrate the latter’s genAI software to device running on Qualcomm’s new Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset, Snapdragon X Compute, as well as its new Snapdragon Cockpit Elite and Ride Elite automotive platforms.

More specifically, the collaboration will bring Mistral AI’s Ministral 3B and Ministral 8B AI models for on-device usage. Due to their relatively compact sizes, the 3B and 8B are ideal for use with hardware including vehicular infotainment systems, smartphones, and even computers. They’re also power-efficient, and feature enhanced privacy capabilities. Durga Malladi, Senior VP GM for technology, planning and edge solutions at Qualcomm states:

We are thrilled to announce our collaboration with Mistral AI to help achieve our goal of empowering devices at the edge with the latest advancements in AI technology… Mistral AI’s Ministral 3B and Ministral 8B will enable device manufacturers, software vendors, and digital service providers to deliver innovative experiences, such as AI assistants and other applications that understand users’ wants and needs, thanks to the immediacy, reliability, and enhanced privacy of on-device AI.

READ: Qualcomm and Google Want to Make Your Next Car More Futuristic

With all that said, we can expect Ministral 3B and 8B to arrive for developers soon via Qualcomm’s AI hub, which already features access to other Mistral AI models including 7B vo.3.
